Travel and identity documents.Why should they help?: The best place to start is the place where the service is supposed to be provided. Familiarise yourself with their mandate to be well-informed when speaking to them.

Members of parliament are each assigned a constituency area by their party. They are required to receive input from the residents of their constituency area.

They are selected to represent the public in parliament by their political party. Each party has a number of seats in parliament based on the number of votes they received in the last national election.
Travel and identity documents.How can you contact them?: Enter your address to get their contact details

Travel and identity documents.Why should they help?: Each minister is the political head of their department. They are selected by the president to oversee the work of their department and lead on policy development.

Travel and identity documents.Who: The Natiotional Assembly committee for Home Affairs
Travel and identity documents.How can you contact them?: PA write to committee form preffilled with this committee

Travel and identity documents.Why should they help?: Everyone has the right to take their issue to court to ask the court to compel the lawful service provider to perform their mandate. Violation of a court order comes with serious consequences for the guilty party.
Travel and identity documents.How can you contact them?:
If you cannot afford a lawyer, find your nearest law clinic.

Enter your address to look up the options nearest to you.

School.Why should they help?:
The best place to start is the place where the service is supposed to be provided. Familiarise yourself with their mandate to be well-informed when speaking to them.

State schools have a responsibility to provide education to enrolled students

Provincial education departments have a mandate to provide functional  and  modern  schools  that  enable  quality  teaching  and  learning  to  protect  and promote the right of every learner to quality, equitable and relevant education.

School.Who: Your Member of the Provincial Legislature
School.How can you contact them?: Enter your address to get their contact details

School.Who: The Member of the Executive Council (MEC) for Basic Education
School.Why should they help?: Each MEC is the political head of their provincial department. They are selected by the premier of their province to oversee the work of their department and lead on policy development.
School.How can you contact them?: Enter your address or select your province to get their contact details

School.Why should they help?: The national department of basic education has a mandate to set policy for basic education in South Africa. It is also mandated to provide oversight and ensure provincial education departments set and reach appropriate targets to meet constitutional and legal obligations in basic education.

Members of parliament are each assigned a constituency area by their party. They are required to receive input from the residents of their constituency area.

They are selected to represent the public in parliament by their political party. Each party has a number of seats in parliament based on the number of votes they received in the last national election.
School.How can you contact them?: Enter your address to get their contact details
